numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The trends for legacy applicants and standard applicants almost mirror each other.
2. Legacy admissions remain higher than standard admissions throughout the whole graph.
3. As income increases, the admission rate increases.
4. I guess that the school wants to increase donations.
5. I guess that the school admits very wealthy individuals to increase donations.
6. I wonder about a tiny dip in the graph around the 90th percentile of wealth.
7. I expect that the admission rate should increase when wealth increases.
8. In general, the admission rate increases when wealth increases.
9. My biggest community is my classmates.
10. We are approaching senior year.
11. The college application process is less than one year away.
12. This graph may not contribute useful information to my applications.
13. This graph highlights inequalities in the admissions process.
14. Some colleges are elite colleges.
15. The polled colleges are elite colleges.
16. This graph changes my perspective about the identity of a university.
17. A university presents itself as a prestigious school.
18. A university presents itself as an elite school.
19. It seems that a university wants money from applicants.
20. The headline is: Real or Rigged: What drives the college admissions process.
